column5: I was having alot of wrist pain and my right arm kept getting cold so I went in to see the doctor about 6 weeks ago. He told me I had to limit my computer time to 15 minutes a day. Now it ain't easy trying to fix, build and maintain websites when you only have fifteen minutes of typing each day. I even used a stopwatch so as to maximize my time! I bought a new mouse pad and wrist bumper for my keyboard with that cushy gel stuff. I must say it is very different and I can type without pain now. I was in the doctors today and most nerve response has gone back to normal. Apparently I was on the way to carpal tunnel issues had I not rested and changed my work station. So with a wireless system now I am more comfy and good to go! To those whose emails I had to ignore...sorry...but we are back in business again! I had to follow these orders strictly or risk no fishing and no computer for life perhaps...a pretty easy decision to make actually.
Welcome back Bubba!  No fishing or computer for life??? That sounds a bit extreme eh?

Good on you Rick,I get back pains during the winter working on the computer and doing office and videos stuff I have no idea how folks work for hours behind a desk,my body does not like it very much Glad things are better
Good to have you back Rick...take care of that wrist bud...  Maureen
wow someone almost ruined a perfectly good computer geek. Glad to hear that you are better it's tough when your job tears up body parts.   Art
Come on fess up,Roy blocked you off the board,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,  WB
Glad to hear things are getting better Rick!  Also, what few posts you did write, were all about helping some of us who were having problems accessing the board....Double thanks for that now!!!
Rick don`t they have devices for handicapped people that allow you to talk and enter? New boat? stay off or cut down, you want to be able to use it! Good Luck Bud!
It's only a matter of time until someone suggests Active Release Therapy for you, Rick.
LOL Doug, I was waiting for that  Maureen
My doc said NO to me,and have been doing well since the theropy. Maybe it,s just not for some.  Maybe it,s all that PHO I been eating.  Or it,s the way I holding my chop stix.
